channel.title: C# on .Net Programmer Incubator
channel.description: Recent content in C# on .Net Programmer Incubator

item.title: The First Appliction in Asp.Net Core
item.description: Create a new project Open Visual Studio and click on “Create a new project” from the start menu. Select the “ASP.NET Core Web App” template and click “Next”. Enter a name for your project and click “Next”. Select the “.NET 7.0(Standard Term Support)” or latest version framework and clic “Create”. The project is created and the “Solution Explorer” window is displayed. Write “Hello World” in the “Index.cshtml” file and debug the project.

item.title: Getting Started
item.description: Install Visual Studio: Go to the Visual Studio download page on the Microsoft website. The link is https://visualstudio.microsoft.com/downloads/. 1. The choice of which edition to use depends on your needs and budget. If you’re an individual developer or a student, the Community edition is likely sufficient. If you’re working on a small team and need more advanced features, the Professional edition may be a better fit. And if you’re part of a large organization that needs the most advanced tools and features, the Enterprise edition is the way to go.
